results.title: Football faux pas
results.brief_description: Migraine Murphy is the imaginery coach of a grid-iron team famous for the mistakes it makes. In humourous fashion the film shows the fumbles, the dropped catches, the clumsiness etc of his team using real game footage. Also shows how things can go wrong in the pre-game razz-ma-tazz.

results.title: Football
results.brief_description: Football (soccer) is a major sport and social phenomenon in Britain, where the game was born. Amateur players are the backbone of the sport, about half a million of them in England alone, mostly young and many belonging to England’s 30,000 amateur clubs. The film explains the history, the competition leading up to the Cup Final and how football is now a world sport including the Chinese, Nigerians and Argentinians who come and play well-known teams in Britain.

results.title: Foot in the air
results.creator_credit: Laura Brearley, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: In Farsi, the word for transition translates as foot in the air. With one foot in the air, Laura Brearley’s life changes dramatically. The injuries she sustained have lasted throughout her life, but they are indicative of both her vulnerability and resilience. On reflection, she realises her transition was not all bad, after all.

results.title: Fools rush in
results.creator_credit: Andy Tennant, Doug Draizin and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: Alex Whitman is a high-flying New York yuppie sent by his company to open a nightclub in Las Vegas. It is a reluctant move for him, though once there, he meets the beautiful Mexican photographer, Isabel Fuentes. Though opposites in nearly every way, romantic sparks fly and the two have a passionate one night stand. Three months later, Isabel shows up pregnant with his child and every intention of keeping it. The two hastily marry in a Vegas chapel while an Elvis impersonator acts as the witness. A head-on collision of cultures ensues, prompting the contemplation of a break-up. A large family gathering, planned by Isabel, grows larger due to surprise family guests, thus creating a comedy of errors before the story draws to its predictable romantic close. Cast includes Matthew Perry, Salma Hayek, Jon Tenney, Carlos Gomez and Tomas Milian.

results.title: Foolish wives (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Erich Von Stroheim and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: Von Stroheim wrote, directed and stars in this enormously expensive and lavish story of decadence and corruption in Monte Carlo after the Great War. Co-starring Maude George and Mae Busch.

results.title: Foolish wives
results.creator_credit: Erich Von Stroheim and Universal Productions
results.brief_description: Posing as a Russian count, Stroheim preys on women; regardless of social class or status. Set in Monte Carlo, the subject matter was considered “repulsive and continental.” Stroheim, bewitching in his monacle is a satanic seducer intent on possessing the wife of an American diplomat from under his nose. The wife is more than obviously attracted to the Count’s fatal charm. “Foolish wives” was an expensive production in its day, and the excellence of the sets and costumes, along with Stroheim’s masterly direction make it a cinema classic.

results.title: Fool for love
results.creator_credit: Robert Altman, Yoram Globus, Menahem Golan and Cannon Group
results.brief_description: Robert Altman (The Player, McCabe and Mrs Miller, Nashville, Gosford Park) adapts Sam Shepard’s one room play with mixed results. Shepard plays Eddie, a handsome cowboy drifter who arrives in a depressing New Mexico roadside motel, lugging a trailer and horses. The aim of Eddie’s visit is to be re-united with the voluptuous May, a barmaid at this barren pit stop’s hotel. For her part May is being wooed by another man but is inextricably drawn to Eddie, despite the proven destructive nature of their union. Over the course of the evening she and Eddie argue violently and make up passionately as the heart-rending history of their relationship, replete with flashbacks, unfurls. Harry Dean Stanton plays a barfly whose identity holds a key role to these lovers’ sorrow. “Fool for love” garnered mostly negative reviews and found a very limited audience, regardless of praise for Basinger’s bravura performance. Most decried the device of opening up the play, outside of its claustrophobic one room structure, in favour of a wider locale, which may have robbed it of the intimate tensions generated by the ill-matched pair battling it out in a confined space. But despite this the incendiary relationship between the principal characters is astutely portrayed, achieving a suitably tragic tone within a desolate setting.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robert Altman, Yoram Globus, Menahem Golan and Cannon Group
